result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W Fredin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in $150 increments per month beginning 9/1/15 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for all purposes, including medical appointments, getting prescriptions, physical therapy; to commence July 2, 2015 by 8:00 am

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua W Fredin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice--Final Notice

Huber law/work release notification
TTP slip
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:12 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC) 
Defendant Joshua W Fredin in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber confirms victim rights compliance, submits victim impact statement; no request to be heard
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Disorderly Conduct (indecent or otherwise disorderly conduct under circumstances that tended to cause a disturbance in a public place) contrary to 947.01(1), a class B misdemeanor
ADA Teuber submits letter from counselor (marked as Sentencing Exh#1)

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for all purposes, including medical appointments, getting prescriptions, physical therapy; to commence July 2, 2015 by 8:00 am
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in $150 increments per month beginning 9/1/15 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Court continues bond until commencement of jail term
Recess: 2:57 pm
for continuance is granted
Jury trial on June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Stipulation and Proposed Order for Continuance of the 6/8/15 FSSC & 6/11/15 Jury Trial
for continuance
Jury trial on June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
States demand w/cover letter
Scheduling order
Jury trial on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Scheduling Notice
Conditions of Bond include:  No contact with Guinevere Decker.

case called at 3:15pm. [MK]
Defendant Joshua W Fredin in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling-- counsel request that the case be scheduled for Status Conference, rather than for Jury Trial at this time.
The Court orders that State is to provide the Defense with Discovery within ten days. 

The Court requires $ 500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Guinevere Decker
recess 3:19pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/4/15 at 9:20am  (2) FSSC on 4/20/15 at 3:00pm (3) Jury Trial on 4/23/15 at 8:30am.
Defendants demand
Attorney Powers
